data.meta_description: Wafer and Integrated Circuits (ICs) Shipping and Handling Market size was USD 6.3 Billion in 2022 and is expected to reach USD 11.58 Billion in 2032, and register a rapid revenue CAGR of 7% during the forecast period.
data.text:
Market Synopsis

The global wafer and Integrated Circuits (ICs) shipping and handling market size was USD 6.3 Billion in 2022 and is expected to reach USD 11.58 Billion in 2032, and register a rapid revenue CAGR of 7% during the forecast period.

Rising consumer electronics demand, rapid growth in the automotive industry, and increasing use of (IoT) device use, are major factors driving market revenue growth. The wafer and IC shipping and handling involves transportation and management of wafers and ICs, which are crucial components of electronic devices.

Download the report summary now! Download Summary

In addition, rising demand for quicker and more effective delivery of electronic goods is another factor driving revenue growth of the market f. Wafer and ICs shipping and handling helps to fulfill the rising demand for smaller, faster, and more powerful electronic devices, requiring efficient and secure handling of delicate and highly sensitive components. Need for wafer and IC shipping and handling is increasing due to the rising demand for high-performance electronic items such as smartphones, tablets, and laptops.

Moreover, introduction of IoT devices is also expected to drive market revenue growth during the forecast period. The demand for wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling is rising by high level of integration and connection that IoT devices require. As manufacturers progressively implement green technology to lessen their carbon footprint, the focus on sustainability and energy efficiency is also expected to rise.

Furthermore, rising adoption of automation to increase productivity and cut costs is another factor driving market revenue growth. There is an increasing need for enhanced packaging and testing services to guarantee the quality and dependability of electronic products.

However, high cost of equipment and lack of competent labor are key factors, which could restrain market revenue growth.

Government Regulations:

The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has established regulations for the safe and efficient transportation of semiconductor wafers, ICs, and other related products via air cargo.

The U.S. Department of Transportation requires carriers to carry out safety inspections on their aircraft and equipment prior to transporting semiconductor wafers, ICs, and other related products.

The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) sets standards for the protection of workers from potential hazards associated with handling and transportation of semiconductor wafers, ICs, and other related products.

The National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) publishes guidance for safe handling and storage of semiconductor wafers, ICs, and other related products.

The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has established regulations for the safe and efficient packaging of semiconductor wafers, ICs, and other related products for air transportation.

Key Takeaways

Shipping Method Outlook:

The growing demand for electronics and the expanding use of automation across numerous sectors are likely to propel the global wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market to substantial growth during the forecast period. The market is divided into surface shipping, air shipping, and other categories based on the mode of transportation.

Throughout the projection period, surface shipping is anticipated to have a sizable revenue share in the market. This is because delivering goods over short- to medium-distances using surface freight is both affordable and dependable. Wafers and integrated circuits may be delivered in huge quantities using surface shipping, which is a key element in this market segment's revenue growth.

Nonetheless, during the forecast period, air shipping is anticipated to have the quickest revenue CAGR. The demand for quick and secure delivery of electronic components, which are sometimes time-sensitive and demand high levels of precision, is credited with this growth. For delivering high-value and low-volume goods like wafers and integrated circuits, air freight offers a quick and dependable form of transportation. The need for air transportation of wafers and integrated circuits is anticipated to grow along with the need for electronics in sectors including automotive, aerospace, and healthcare, which will support revenue development.

Throughout the forecast period, it is anticipated that other shipping methods, such as sea shipping, rail shipping, and road shipment, will contribute a smaller revenue share to the market. These techniques are appropriate for low-value products and are frequently utilized for shipping large numbers of goods across vast distances. Wafers and integrated circuits are high-value products, hence these shipping techniques might not be appropriate for sending them across long distances.

End-Use Outlook:

Consumer electronics, automotive, healthcare, aerospace & military, and other industries make up the consumer electronics end-use industry section of the global wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market.

Over the forecast period, the consumer electronics sector is anticipated to hold a sizable revenue share in the market. The expansion of this market is being driven by the rising demand for smartphones, tablets, laptops, and other electronic devices. The demand for wafers and integrated circuits in the consumer electronics industry is being driven by the downsizing of electronics components and the integration of numerous functionalities into a single chip. The desire for these components to be delivered quickly and securely is anticipated to fuel the market's expansion in terms of revenue.

Another significant end-use sector in the worldwide wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market is the automobile sector. The adoption of automation and electric vehicles is accelerating, which is fueling the expansion of this market. Engine management, safety systems, and entertainment systems are just a few of the applications for wafers and integrated circuits in the vehicle industry. The market in this sector is anticipated to increase in terms of revenue due to the demand for high-quality and dependable components.

Throughout the projected period, the global wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market is anticipated to rise significantly for the healthcare sector. The expansion of this market is being driven by the rising usage of healthcare solutions and medical equipment. Medical gadgets such as imaging systems, patient monitoring systems, and diagnostic equipment all make use of wafers and integrated circuits. The desire for these components to be delivered quickly and securely is anticipated to fuel the market's expansion in terms of revenue.

Another significant end-use sector in the worldwide wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market is the aerospace and defense sector. This market is expanding as a result of the rising demand for unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), satellites, and other military systems. Communication systems, navigation systems, and radar systems are just a few of the aerospace and defense applications that use wafers and integrated circuits. The market in this sector is anticipated to increase in terms of revenue due to the demand for high-quality and dependable components.

Industrial automation, power and energy, among others, is one of the other end-use industries in the global wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling industry. These segments are expanding as a result of rising automation adoption and rising need for renewable energy solutions. Robotics, control systems, and sensor systems are just a few of the industrial automation applications that make use of wafers and integrated circuits. The market in these categories is anticipated to rise in revenue due to the demand for quick and secure delivery of these components.

Regional Outlook:

Throughout the anticipated period, the wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market in the Asia-Pacific region is anticipated to have considerable expansion. Growth in the market is being fueled by the region's supremacy in the semiconductor sector, particularly in nations like China and South Korea. Wafer and integrated circuit demand in the region is being driven by an increase in demand for electronic devices like smartphones, laptops, and gaming consoles. The area also has some of the biggest foundries and semiconductor production plants, which is helping the market grow even more.

Throughout the anticipated period, the wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market in North America is anticipated to expand steadily. The growing need for cutting-edge technologies like IoT, 5G, and AI, which rely significantly on integrated circuits, is the main driver of the region's growth. The introduction of cutting-edge manufacturing technologies like automation and is also anticipated to fuel market expansion. Also, the region is seeing rising investments in R&D projects related to semiconductor production, which is further fueling industry expansion.

Throughout the anticipated period, the wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market in Europe is anticipated to experience moderate growth. The existence of significant semiconductor businesses, research organizations, and universities is what fuels the region's growth. The region's automotive industry, which is seeing an increase in the use of electric vehicles and advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS), which significantly rely on integrated circuits, is also a significant contributor to the market growth. A major factor driving the need for integrated circuits in the region is the growing adoption of Industry 4.0 technology.

Request for customisation

Competitive Landscape:

The global wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market is highly competitive and is characterized by the presence of numerous large and small players. The market is expected to witness significant growth in the coming years, owing to the increasing demand for advanced semiconductor products, such as microprocessors, memory chips, and power devices. Some major players operating in the global wafer and integrated circuits shipping and handling market include:

Advantest Corporation

Applied Materials, Inc.

Brooks Automation, Inc.

KLA Corporation

Lam Research Corporation

MEI Wet Processing Systems and Services LLC

TEL NEXX, Inc.

Asyst Technologies LLC

Entegris, Inc.

Mattson Technology, Inc.

Strategic Developments:

In 2021, Lam Research Corporation acquired Coventor, Inc., a leading provider of 3D modeling and simulation software for the semiconductor industry. The acquisition was aimed at expanding Lam Research's product portfolio and strengthening its position in the market.

In 2021, KLA Corporation acquired Orbotech Ltd., a leading supplier of equipment and services for the production of printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The acquisition was valued at around $3.4 billion and aimed to expand KLA's product offerings in the semiconductor and electronics markets.

In 2020, Brooks Automation, Inc. acquired Precise Automation, Inc., a leading provider of collaborative robots and automation systems for the semiconductor industry. The acquisition was aimed at expanding Brooks Automation's product portfolio and strengthening its position in the market.

In 2020, Entegris, Inc. acquired MPD Chemicals, a leading provider of advanced materials for the semiconductor and electronics industries. The acquisition was aimed at expanding Entegris' product offerings and enhancing its capabilities in materials science and engineering.

New Product Launches:

Applied Materials, Inc.: In 2021, Applied Materials, Inc. launched a new line of semiconductor manufacturing systems called the Endura® platform. These systems are designed to provide advanced wafer processing capabilities for the production of high-performance chips, such as memory and logic devices. The Endura® platform also features advanced process control and real-time monitoring capabilities.

KLA Corporation: In 2021, KLA Corporation launched a new line of inspection and metrology systems called the Candela® platform. These systems are designed to provide advanced imaging and analysis capabilities for the detection of defects and process variations in semiconductor devices. The Candela® platform also features advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning capabilities for improved defect detection and classification.

Lam Research Corporation: In 2020, Lam Research Corporation launched a new line of wafer cleaning systems called the SOLA® platform. These systems are designed to provide advanced wafer cleaning capabilities for the production of high-performance chips, such as memory and logic devices. The SOLA® platform also features advanced process control and real-time monitoring capabilities.

Segments Covered in the Report:

This report offers historical data and forecasts revenue growth at a global, regional, and country level, and provides analysis of market trends in each of segments and sub-segments from 2019 to 2032. For the purpose of this report, Reports and Data has segmented the global wafer and ICs shipping and handling market based on shipping method, end-use industry, and region:
